description: Validation templates for normalizing validation contracts across dimensions

DIM01_INSUMOS.description: Validates diagnostic rigor with territorial coverage and official sources
DIM01_INSUMOS.colombian_context: Diagnóstico territorial must cite DANE, local observatories, or official registries

DIM01_INSUMOS.description: Validates baseline indicators have quantitative values, sources, and temporal references
DIM01_INSUMOS.colombian_context: DNP requires baselines with at least 3-year time series for trend analysis

DIM01_INSUMOS.description: Validates that gaps between current state and desired state are explicitly identified
DIM01_INSUMOS.colombian_context: Brechas must be quantified (e.g., 'current: 45%, target: 80%, gap: 35 p.p.')

DIM01_INSUMOS.description: Validates identification of available resources and resource gaps
DIM01_INSUMOS.colombian_context: Must reference SGP, royalties, or other financing sources
PDET municipalities must disaggregate data to vereda level when possible

DIM02_ACTIVIDADES.description: Verifies explicit causal connections between activity and problem
DIM02_ACTIVIDADES.colombian_context: Activities in Colombian PDMs must explicitly link to diagnosed problems

DIM02_ACTIVIDADES.description: Validates that activities have corresponding budget allocation
DIM02_ACTIVIDADES.colombian_context: BPIN/SIGOP numbering required for Colombian investment projects
Secretaría, entidad, or dependencia must be named
Activities must fit within 4-year mayoral term

DIM03_PRODUCTOS.description: Validates products are concretely specified with measurable indicators
DIM03_PRODUCTOS.colombian_context: Products (bienes y servicios) must follow BPIN structure: quantity + unit + timeframe

DIM03_PRODUCTOS.description: Validates indicator has explicit calculation formula
DIM03_PRODUCTOS.colombian_context: Formula must be verifiable (e.g., '(Número de viviendas mejoradas / Total viviendas) * 100')

DIM03_PRODUCTOS.description: Validates product has designated verification source and responsible entity
DIM03_PRODUCTOS.colombian_context: Source must be official (DANE, SISBEN, Sistema de Información sectorial)

DIM03_PRODUCTOS.description: Validates product is linked to budget allocation in PPI
DIM03_PRODUCTOS.colombian_context: Must reference specific line in Plan Plurianual de Inversiones (PPI)

DIM03_PRODUCTOS.description: Validates product is traceable to specific activities (DIM02)
DIM03_PRODUCTOS.colombian_context: Products must derive from activities via clear input-output logic

DIM03_PRODUCTOS.description: Validates product has annualized delivery schedule
DIM03_PRODUCTOS.colombian_context: 4-year term must show phased delivery (e.g., Year 1: 25%, Year 2: 30%, Year 3: 30%, Year 4: 15%)

DIM04_RESULTADOS.description: Verifies outcomes are traceable to products
DIM04_RESULTADOS.colombian_context: Results must derive from products (Ley 152 de 1994)

DIM04_RESULTADOS.description: Validates outcome indicators have baseline, target, and unit

DIM04_RESULTADOS.colombian_context: DNP requires measurable outcomes for follow-up

DIM05_IMPACTOS.description: Verifies impact chain from outcomes to long-term impacts
DIM05_IMPACTOS.colombian_context: Impacts are long-term (10+ years) structural changes

DIM05_IMPACTOS.description: Validates impact aligns with theory of change
DIM05_IMPACTOS.colombian_context: Must align with Teoría de Cambio del PDM
Impact targets must be ambitious yet municipality-feasible

DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.description: Verifies complete causal chain from activities to impacts
DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.colombian_context: Cadena de resultados must be complete

DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.description: Validates key assumptions are explicitly stated
DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.colombian_context: Supuestos y riesgos must be documented

DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.description: Detects circular reasoning or logical fallacies
DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.colombian_context: Common fallacy: 'we will achieve X by achieving X'

DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.description: Validates causal logic is adapted to municipal context
DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.colombian_context: Causal mechanisms must reflect municipal realities
